New Records: The Chicago White Sox remain tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in a season during Major League Baseball’s modern era.
Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi knocked in Miguel Vargas with a single to left-center in the 10th inning, giving the Sox a 4-3 victory against the Los Angeles Angels.
The Sox regained the lead on a solo home run by Lenyn Sosa with one out in the fourth.
The Angels tied it with a pair of two-out runs in the fourth.
The Sox escaped more damage with an inning-ending 5-4-3 double play in the eighth.
Jared Shuster got Eric Wagaman to double play started by shortstop Nicky Lopez in the 10th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Sox were trying to finish strong with four games remaining.
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Grady Sizemore said, 'Any time you can walk off, it’s a great feeling. Great energy in the clubhouse. Guys love that. We’re trying to build something here, these are the kinds of games you can create some momentum with, especially here late in the year.'
Sizemore said, 'It’s just nice to see and hopefully we can finish it off (in Thursday’s series finale) and move on to Detroit.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had a little bit of everything.
There were home runs for the Sox from Korey Lee and Lenyn Sosa.
There was a squeeze bunt for the Angels that tied it late.
The Sox defense made three critical double plays.
Others: The Sox secured a series victory and held off history for another day.
